verbose_text: In short, liver failure was defined by hyperbilirubinaemia, kidney failure by acute kidney injury (AKI diagnostic criteria for patients with cirrhosis, i.e. abrupt increase in serum creatinine level), cerebral failure by West Haven criteria for HE, respiratory failure by hypoxaemia (PaO 2, SpO 2), circulatory failure by mean arterial pressure (MAP), and coagulation failure by the international normalized ratio (INR) [XREF_BIBR].
